sparrowCore

SparrowCore is for creating a SDL window, creating optimal surfaces for blitting on these window, for program main loops with feeedback functions for drawing, calculation and different kinds of event handling.  Furthermore here are some helper functions like converting colors or checking, whether a file exists.

Summary
sparrowCoreSparrowCore is for creating a SDL window, creating optimal surfaces for blitting on these window, for program main loops with feeedback functions for drawing, calculation and different kinds of event handling.
Macros
SP_ANALOG_AXIS_MINThe minimal value of the analog axis
SP_ANALOG_AXIS_MAXThe maximal value of the analog axis
SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_ONif a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!)
SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_OFFif a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!)
SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_ONif a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!)
SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_OFFif a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!)
SP_CACHE_SIZEThe size of the surface cache
SP_INPUT_BUTTON_COUNTThe maximal count of buttons on the generic device.
SP_INPUT_AXIS_COUNTCount of axis on the generic device.
SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAITThis determines, how long it takes until a key will be entered a second time if it is still pressed.
SP_KEYBOARD_WAITIf a key is pressed longer than SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, it takes this time for the key to react again.
SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_NEVERUsed by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.
SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_IF_NEEDEDUsed by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.
SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_ALWAYSUsed by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.
SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAITThis determines, how long it takes until a virtual key will be entered a second time if it is still pressed.
SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_WAITIf a key is pressed longer than SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, it takes this time for the virtual key to react again.
Functions
spInitCorespInitCore initializes SDL, SDL_TTF and other stuff.
spPrintDebugspPrintDebug prints debug stuff with timestamp

Macros

SP_ANALOG_AXIS_MIN

The minimal value of the analog axis

SP_ANALOG_AXIS_MAX

The maximal value of the analog axis

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_ON

if a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!) has a analog stick, these are the limits, from which the generic axis are uneven 0 or reseted to 0 again

See Also

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_OFF, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_ON, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_OFF

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_OFF

if a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!) has a analog stick, these are the limits, from which the generic axis are uneven 0 or reseted to 0 again

See Also

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_ON, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_ON, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_OFF

SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_ON

if a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!) has a analog stick, these are the limits, from which the generic axis are uneven 0 or reseted to 0 again

See Also

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_ON, SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_OFF, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_OFF

SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_OFF

if a REAL input device (not the sparrow3d generic input device!) has a analog stick, these are the limits, from which the generic axis are uneven 0 or reseted to 0 again

See Also

SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_ON, SP_JOYSTICK_MIN_TRIGGER_OFF, SP_JOYSTICK_MAX_TRIGGER_ON

SP_CACHE_SIZE

The size of the surface cache

SP_INPUT_BUTTON_COUNT

The maximal count of buttons on the generic device.  If you “blind” grep for all buttons, don’t test further then this value!

See Also

SP_INPUT_AXIS_COUNT

SP_INPUT_AXIS_COUNT

Count of axis on the generic device.  Should never change in fact.

See Also

SP_INPUT_BUTTON_COUNT

SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT

This determines, how long it takes until a key will be entered a second time if it is still pressed.

See Also

SP_KEYBOARD_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_WAIT

SP_KEYBOARD_WAIT

If a key is pressed longer than SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, it takes this time for the key to react again.

See Also

SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_WAIT

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_NEVER

Used by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.  Says, that never a virtual keyboard shall be shown.

See Also

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_IF_NEEDED, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_ALWAYS

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_IF_NEEDED

Used by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.  Says, that a virtual keyboard shall be shown, if the device don’t have a hardware keyboard.

See Also

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_NEVER, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_ALWAYS

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_ALWAYS

Used by <spSetVirtualKeyboard>.  Shows a virtual keyboard on every device, even PC or Pandora.

See Also

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_IF_NEEDED, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_IF_NEEDED

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT

This determines, how long it takes until a virtual key will be entered a second time if it is still pressed.

See Also

SP_KEYBOARD_WAIT, SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_WAIT

SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_WAIT

If a key is pressed longer than SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, it takes this time for the virtual key to react again.

See Also

SP_KEYBOARD_WAIT, SP_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT, SP_VIRTUAL_KEYBOARD_FIRST_WAIT

Functions

spInitCore

PREFIX void spInitCore(void)

spInitCore initializes SDL, SDL_TTF and other stuff.

Returns

Nothing
